newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish PZU limits motor liability insurance rise.
newsitem.headline: Polish PZU limits motor liability insurance rise.

text.p: Poland's largest insurer, Powszechny Zaklad Ubezpieczen SA (PZU), on Thursday reduced a rise in motor liability insurance premiums to 33 percent from earlier announced 43 percent, PAP quoted PZU's president as saying.
"PZU lowered the motor liability insurance by 10 percent from earlier proposals. Currently the average increase amounts to 33 percent," PAP quoted Jan Monkiewicz as saying.
Prime Minister Wlodzimierz Cimoszewicz earlier this week suggested he might dismiss the management of state-owned PZU if it failed to limit the scope of the increase.
Second largest insurer Warta, which earlier raised its premiums by 33 percent, said it would consider the PZU move and did not rule out a change in its own rise.
"The decision over a possible change will be taken after we know details about PZU's premiums," Warta's spokesman told Reuters.
Polisa officials were not immediately available for comment. Polisa earlier raised its motor liability premiums by 50 percent.
